div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1788 Nisibis, Mesopotamia, 1955 Burial: after 31 B.C. Contents: 1 AR, 623 AE Thessaly: 1 AE Gaziura: 1 AE Amorium: 1 AE Mopsuestia: 5 AE Soli, Cilicia: 2 AE Tigranes I, Armenia: 11 AE Seleucus IV: 2 AE (Antiocheia) Antiochus IV: 3 AE (Seleuceia ad Tigrim 2, Antiocheia 1) Antiochus V: 1 AE (Seleuceia ad Tigrim) Demetrius I: 4 AE (Antiocheia) Alexander I Bala: 11 AE (Antiocheia 10, Ace 1) Demetrius II, 1st reign: 1 AE (Antiocheia) Antiochus VI: 3 AE (Antiocheia) Tryphon: 1 AE (Antiocheia) Antiochus VII: 16 AE (Antiocheia 13, unc. 3) Demetrius II, 2nd reign: 1 AE (Antiocheia) Alexander Zabinas: 4 AE (Antiocheia) Antiochus VIII and Cleopatra: 3 AE (An- tiocheia) Antiochus VIII: 65 AE (Antiocheia) Antiochus IX: 40 AE (Antiocheia 34, Da- mascus? 6) Demetrius III: 10 AE (unc. mint) Antiochus XII: 7 AE (Damascus) Mithradates I, Commagene: 4 AE Antiocheia: 214 AE Apameia: 1 AE Laodiceia: 1 AE Seleuceia Pieria: 1 AE Damascus as Demetrias: 1 AE Aradus: 18 AE Sidon: 1 AE John Hyrcanus or Judas Aristobulos: 2 AE Aretas III, Nabataea: 1 AE (Damascus) Natunia, Assyria: 2 AE Seleuceia ad Tigrim: 72 AE Mithradates II, Parthia: 1 AE Unc. oriental mints: 19 AE Unc. Mint: 1 AE Illeg.: 91 AE Roman Rep.: 1 den. (plated) Disposition: unknown Seyrig, RN 1955, pp. 85-128, illus.; 1959-60, p. 291
